headline: Nvidia's China AI Chip Deal In Unchartered Territory, Experts Say; Is Nvidia A Buy Or Sell Now?
summary: Nvidia wavered during Tuesday's session.  Investors in the prior session began reacting to the artificial intelligence chip titan's deal that secured a license to sell its H20 AI chips in China, but, in exchange, will give 15% of their revenue from chip sales in China to the U.S. government. Is Nvidia stock a buy or sell now?  The move could invite scrutiny, according to Doug Jacobson, an international trade attorney at Jacobson Burton Kelley, Barron's reported.

raw.headline: Nvidia's China AI Chip Deal In Unchartered Territory, Experts Say; Is Nvidia A Buy Or Sell Now?
raw.summary: Nvidia wavered during Tuesday's session.  Investors in the prior session began reacting to the artificial intelligence chip titan's deal that secured a license to sell its H20 AI chips in China, but, in exchange, will give 15% of their revenue from chip sales in China to the U.S. government. Is Nvidia stock a buy or sell now?  The move could invite scrutiny, according to Doug Jacobson, an international trade attorney at Jacobson Burton Kelley, Barron's reported.

headline: White House says chips deals could perhaps expand to other companies
summary: (Reuters) -The White House said on Tuesday that perhaps deals could be expanded to other chip companies after Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices agreed to give the U.S. government 15% of revenue from sales to China of certain advanced chips.

headline: Trump Drives Markets These Days. Economic Data Take a Back Seat.
summary: U.S. markets remained focused on Tuesday’s July inflation data, as investors track growing price pressures from tariffs into next month’s crucial Federal Reserve rate decision in Washington.  The same could be said for the domestic auto sector, which has found itself holding the short end of the global tariff stick following trade agreements with the U.K., Europe and Japan that effectively make it cheaper to build cars outside of North America and sell them in the U.S.

raw.headline: Trump Drives Markets These Days. Economic Data Take a Back Seat.

headline: Forget the White House Sideshow. Intel Must Decide What It Wants to Be.
summary: Five months in and Lip-Bu Tan is already fighting for his job.  The identity question—whether Intel wants to be a chip designer, a manufacturer, or remain both of those things—was possible to gloss over in Tan’s early days as chief executive.  President Trump last week took the unprecedented step of publicly calling for Tan to resign.

raw.headline: Forget the White House Sideshow. Intel Must Decide What It Wants to Be.
raw.summary: Five months in and Lip-Bu Tan is already fighting for his job.  The identity question—whether Intel wants to be a chip designer, a manufacturer, or remain both of those things—was possible to gloss over in Tan’s early days as chief executive.  President Trump last week took the unprecedented step of publicly calling for Tan to resign.

headline: Heard on the Street Monday Recap: Trump Extends China Tariff Deadline
summary: President Trump extended the deadline for higher tariffs on China until Nov. 9.  Levies were set to rise Tuesday, but Trump’s extension allows for further negotiations and a potential meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping this fall.  The Dow Industrials dropped 0.5%, while the Nasdaq Composite declined 0.3% and the S&P 500 fell 0.25%.

raw.headline: Heard on the Street Monday Recap: Trump Extends China Tariff Deadline
raw.summary: President Trump extended the deadline for higher tariffs on China until Nov. 9.  Levies were set to rise Tuesday, but Trump’s extension allows for further negotiations and a potential meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping this fall.  The Dow Industrials dropped 0.5%, while the Nasdaq Composite declined 0.3% and the S&P 500 fell 0.25%.

headline: Trump Met With Intel CEO, Says Tan Will Bring ‘Suggestions’ Next Week
summary: After meeting with  Intel  CEO Lip-Bu Tan Monday, President Donald Trump struck a more conciliatory tone than he had last week when he called for Tan’s resignation.  “The meeting was a very interesting one,” Trump posted to Truth Social.  Trump had called for Tan to resign in a post last Thursday, saying the Intel CEO was “highly conflicted,” following a letter sent by Republican Sen. Tom Cotton questioning Tan’s links to Chinese firms.

raw.headline: Trump Met With Intel CEO, Says Tan Will Bring ‘Suggestions’ Next Week
raw.summary: After meeting with  Intel  CEO Lip-Bu Tan Monday, President Donald Trump struck a more conciliatory tone than he had last week when he called for Tan’s resignation.  “The meeting was a very interesting one,” Trump posted to Truth Social.  Trump had called for Tan to resign in a post last Thursday, saying the Intel CEO was “highly conflicted,” following a letter sent by Republican Sen. Tom Cotton questioning Tan’s links to Chinese firms.
